children.name: melt down x
children.definition: melt down to melt sth such as a metal object, especially so that you can make it into sth different:nấu chảy
examples: melt down sth/ melt sth down
he melts down coins to make into earrings and ornaments.
we collected all the old candles and melted them down to make one big candle.

children.name: weld x
children.definition: weld to join two pieces of metal together permanently by melting the parts that touch: hàn
examples: iron spikes have been welded(on) tothe railings around the embassy.
the new handle will have to be welded on.
weld[ c ] a joint made by welding : mối hàn
welder[ c ] a person whose job is welding : thợ hàn
welding[ u ] the activity of joining metal parts together

children.name: strike x
children.definition: strike to make a metal disc-shaped object such as a coin with a machine that quickly presses a picture into a piece of metal: đúc
examples: when was the first poundcoinstruck?
a special medal has been struck to celebrate the end of the war.

children.name: solder x
children.definition: solder to join pieces of metal together using solder: hàn
examples: solder[u] a soft metal that is melted in order to join together pieces of metal so that they stick together when it cools and becomes hard again: chất hàn
soldering iron[c] a tool which you use for heating solder: mỏ hàn

children.name: steelworks x
children.definition: steelworks a factory where steel is made: xưởng luyện thép; xưởng cán thép

children.name: blast furnace x
children.definition: blast furnace a container in which iron is produced by blowing extremely hot air through a mixture of iron ore , coke and limestone : lò luyện kim

children.name: ironworks x
children.definition: ironworks a factory where iron is produced or iron objects are made: xưởng làm đồ sắt

children.name: smelter x
children.definition: smelter a factory or machine in which metal is smelted: lò nấu chảy kim loại

children.name: be a metal but not an element
gold leaf x
children.definition: gold leaf gold which has been beaten into extremely thin sheets and is used to cover things such as picture frames for decoration: vàng lá

children.name: steel b2
children.definition: steel strong metal that can be shaped easily, consisting of iron and carbon: thép
examples: steel girders/rods/struts
a steel helmet
a steel-plated army truck
stainless steel[a type of steel containing chromium , which does not chemically react with air or water and does not change its colour] thép không gỉ, i nốc
stainless steel(= steel that does not change colour )knives

children.name: brass c1
children.definition: brass a bright yellow metal made from copper and zinc : đồng thau
examples: the door handles were made of brass.

children.name: bronze c2
children.definition: bronze a brown metal made of copper and tinn : đồng thiếc; đồng thanh
examples: the church bells are made of bronze.

children.name: alloy x
children.definition: alloy a metal that is made by mixing two or more metals, or a metal and another substance: hợp kim
examples: brass is an alloyofcopper and zinc.

children.name: cast iron x
children.definition: cast iron a type of hard iron that will not bend easily and is made into shapes by being poured into a mould when melted : gang

children.name: metal b1
children.definition: metal a chemical element, such as iron or gold, or a mixture of such elements, such as steel, which electricity and heatcan travel through and which is generally hard and strong: kim loại
examples: metal, paper and glass can be recycled.
the wooden beam is reinforced with a metal plate.
base metal[specialized] a common metal such as lead , tin or copper which is not a precious metal and which reacts easily with other chemicals :kim loại thường (phân biệt với kim loại quý)
heavy metal[specialized] a dense (= heavy in relation to its size) and usually poisonous metal, such as lead: kim loại nặng
precious metal[a metal which is valuable and usually rare] kim loại quý hiếm
platinum and gold are precious metals.
silver, gold and platinum arepreciousmetals.

children.name: metalwork x
children.definition: metalwork the activity or skill of making metal objects : luyện kim
examples: her favourite subject at school is metalwork.
students can study woodwork or metalwork.

children.name: metallurgy x
children.definition: metallurgy the scientific study of the structures and uses of metals: ngành luyện kim
examples: she has a doctorate in metallurgy from the university of utah.
metallurgical[adj]
a metallurgical process
the metallurgical industry

children.name: smith x
children.definition: smith sb who makes and repairs things made of iron: thợ rèn
examples: blacksmith[c] sb who makes and repairs things made of iron, especially horseshoes : thợ rèn
smithsuffix
goldsmith/ silversmith etc
a goldsmith/silversmith

children.name: farrier x
children.definition: farrier  a person who makes and fits metal plates for horses' feet: thợ đóng móng ngựa

children.name: metallurgist x
children.definition: metallurgist a person who studies or knows about metals : nhà luyện kim

children.name: steelwoker x
children.definition: steelworker công nhân ngành thép
examples: a person who works in a factory making steel

children.name: metal detector x
children.definition: metal detector a machine that you move over the ground or a surface to discover if there is metal there: thiết bị dò tìm kim loại
examples: he goes round fields and beaches with his metal detector, hoping to find buried treasure.

children.name: ingot x
children.definition: ingot a piece of metal, usually in the shape of a narrow brick: thỏi ,thanh ( kim loại...)
examples: a gold/silver ingot

children.name: ironwork x
children.definition: ironwork things made of iron such as gates, especially if made in a decorated way: đồ sắt

children.name: wire b2
children.definition: wire a piece of thin metal thread which can be bent, used for fastening things and for making particular types of objects that are strong but can bend: dây kim loại (khác với dây điện)
examples: a wire fence

children.name: metalwork x
children.definition: metalwork objects made by shaping metal or the metal part of sth: đồ kim loại
examples: rust has damaged the metalwork of the bicycle.
a huge collection of antique metalwork

children.name: scrap c2
children.definition: scrap old cars and machines or pieces of metal, etc. that are not now needed but have parts that can be used to make other things: kim loại vụn; phế liệu
examples: scrap iron/metal
we've sold our old carforscrap.

children.name: gilded x
children.definition: gilded covered with a thin layer of gold or a substance that looks like gold: mạ vàng
examples: the gilded dome of the cathedral rises above the city.
a gilded frame
gilt[adj] covered with a thin layer of gold or a substance which is intended to look like it: mạ vàng
a gilt picture frame
it's not solid gold - it's just gilt.
gild[ t ] to cover a surfacewith a thin layer of gold or a substance that looks like gold: mạ vàng

children.name: sterling x
children.definition: sterling(of precious metal, especially silver) of a fixed standard of purity: thật, đúng tuổi
examples: a sterling silver candlestick

children.name: solid c1
children.definition: soliddescribes a metal which is pure, and does not have anything else mixed together with it: thuần nhất
examples: solid gold/ silver etc
solid gold/ silver candlesticks
a solid gold cup

children.name: -plated x
children.definition: -platedsuffix mạ
examples: gold-plated/ silver-plated etc
gold-plated earrings are much cheaper than solid gold ones.
plateverb[ t ] to cover a metal object with a thin layer of another metal, especially gold or silver : mạ
we normally plate the car handleswithnickel and then chrome.
plating[ u ]
gold/silver plating
